io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline

Class RPGGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame
      • io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline.RPGGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.newdawn.slick.ControlledInputReciever, org.newdawn.slick.ControllerListener, org.newdawn.slick.Game, org.newdawn.slick.InputListener, org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener, org.newdawn.slick.MouseListener

    public abstract class RPGGame
extends org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame

    A class with added support for RPGOnline games. This class is based on StateBasedGame. In addition, some parts of loading (e.g. Music) can be deferred by overriding the load method.

    Author:
    Tomaso2468

    • Field Detail

      • max

        private long max
        The maximum value of the loading bar. This should be a long in the range 0 to Long.MAX_VALUE.

      • value

        private long value
        The current value of the loading bar. This should be a long in the range 0 to Long.MAX_VALUE.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RPGGame

        public RPGGame(java.lang.String title)

        Create a new RPGGame.

        The creation of this object will write some information to the log (via RPGOnline.queryVersionData()).

        Parameters:
        title - The name of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • textureLoad

        public abstract void textureLoad(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer container,
                                 RPGGame game,
                                 LoadCounter counter)
                          throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        A method during which textures are loaded. This should be overridden with a method to load the required textures.

        Parameters:
        container - The container holding the game.
        game - This game.
        counter - An interface providing access to a loading screen.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - Indicates an internal error occurred in the game.

                   throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        A method during which music and other things that do not require an OpenGL context.

        Parameters:

        counter - An interface providing access to a loading screen.

      • getStates

        public java.util.HashMap getStates()
                            throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        A method that gets the hashmap containing all states in this game. This method uses reflection to bypass slick2Ds restrictions.
        Returns:
        A hashmap.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - If an error occurs trying to get all game states.

      • getTargetFrameRate

        public int getTargetFrameRate()
                       throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Gets the target frame rate of the game.
        Returns:
        A positive int value or -1 if no frame rate is set.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - If an error occurs getting the target frame rate.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
                   throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Sets this game to fullscreen. This requires an AppGameContainer to be used.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - true if the game should be in fullscreen., false otherwise.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - If an error occurs setting the fullscreen settings.

      • getWindowedScreenSize

        protected int[] getWindowedScreenSize()
        Gets the size of the game when windowed.
        Returns:
        An 2 int array containing width data at i=0 and height data at i=1.

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Checks if the game is in fullscreen.
        Returns:
        true if the game is in fullscreen, false otherwise.

        Returns:
        A non-null string.

      • drawDebugLineLabel

        protected float drawDebugLineLabel(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                                   java.lang.String label,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   float y,
                                   boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRYWHigh

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWHigh(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                                     java.lang.String label,
                                     long data,
                                     long yellow,
                                     long red,
                                     float y,
                                     boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats higher values as better so if the value is below red the text is a pale red, if the value is below yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is below both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRYWLow

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWLow(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    long data,
                                    long yellow,
                                    long red,
                                    float y,
                                    boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats lower values as better so if the value is above red the text is a pale red, if the value is above yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is above both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

                                     double yellow,
                                     double red,
                                     float y,
                                     boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats higher values as better so if the value is below red the text is a pale red, if the value is below yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is below both the text is a pale red.

        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.

        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.

      • drawDebugLineRYWLow

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWLow(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    double data,
                                    double yellow,
                                    double red,
                                    float y,
                                    boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats lower values as better so if the value is above red the text is a pale red, if the value is above yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is above both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRAM

        protected float drawDebugLineRAM(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                                 java.lang.String label,
                                 double data,
                                 double max,
                                 double yellow,
                                 double red,
                                 float y,
                                 boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats higher values as better so if the value is below red the text is a pale red, if the value is below yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is below both the text is a pale red. This method treats the inputs as ram information in mebibytes (MiB).
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.
